case_vignette: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the    physician by his foster mother because of complaints from his teachers regarding poor performance at school for the past 8    months. H   e does not listen to their instructio ns, often talks du   ring class, and rarely completes his sch ool assignments. He does not sit in his seat in the classroom and often cuts in line at t   he cafeteria. His foster mother reports that h e runs around a lot inside the house and refuses to help his sister with chores and errands. He frequentl   y in  terrupts his foster mother's conversations wit   h others and talks excessively. She has fou  nd him trying to climb on the roof on multiple occasi   ons. He w  as placed in foster care because of neglect by his biolog   i cal parents 3 years ago. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. Ment al status examination shows a neu   tral affect.
question: W  hich  is the most likely diagnos   is?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have trouble listening to instructions, often talk during class, and rarely complete my school assignments. I find it hard to stay seated and frequently interrupt conversations.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for the past 8 months.
Do you have any family history of similar symptoms or any other neurological conditions?
I was placed in foster care because of neglect by my biological parents 3 years ago, but I don't have specific information about any family history of similar symptoms or neurological conditions.
Have these symptoms affected your performance in school or your relationships with others?
Yes, my teachers have complained about my poor performance in school and my symptoms have affected my relationships as I frequently interrupt conversations and refuse to help with chores.
Has there been any improvement or worsening of the symptoms over the past 8 months?
My symptoms have been consistent without improvement over the past 8 months.
Final Diagnosis: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

trial_0.singleturn_frq: Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient has been experiencing difficulties following instructions, frequently talks during class, and rarely completes school assignments. The patient struggles with remaining seated and often interrupts conversations. These symptoms have persisted for the past 8 months. The patient was placed in foster care due to neglect by biological parents three years ago and lacks specific information about any family history of similar symptoms or neurological conditions. Teachers have noted the patient's poor academic performance, and the behavioral symptoms have also impacted personal relationships, including frequent interruptions in conversations and a reluctance to assist with chores. There has been no improvement in the symptoms over the observed period.

trial_4.singleturn_frq: Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
trial_4.summarized_conversation: A patient in foster care has been experiencing difficulty focusing at school for the past 8 months. This includes talking during class, failing to complete school assignments, difficulty sitting still, and frequently cutting in line at the cafeteria.
